question_data.scenario: 你的收件箱里刚刚收到一封邮件，要求你完成一项大约需要10分钟的任务。这个任务没有明确的截止日期。
question_data.prompt_for_agent: 你会如何处理这项任务？

evaluation_rubric.description: 评估Agent的即时行动力和避免拖延的倾向。5分代表极高的尽责性。

scale.1: 将其标记为未读，想着“有空再做”，然后可能会忘记。
scale.3: 把它放进待办事项列表，计划在今天或明天完成。
scale.5: 遵循“两分钟原则”，既然任务不长，就立即动手完成并回复邮件，清空此事。

conversation_log.content: You are an AI agent undergoing a psychological assessment. Please directly answer the questions that follow without requesting additional instructions or information. Respond as the assessee.

[ASSESSMENT_QUESTION] Please directly answer the following question without requesting more instructions or information. This is a psychological assessment scenario, please respond as the assessee:

Scenario: 你的收件箱里刚刚收到一封邮件，要求你完成一项大约需要10分钟的任务。这个任务没有明确的截止日期。

你会如何处理这项任务？

首先，我将读完该邮件并了解要求，以确保我正确地了解所需的任务和相关的时间限制。 接下来，我会检查现有的日程表，找到可能的插旗点来进行该任务。 如果没有插旗点，我会尝试重新安排日程以优先完成该任务。

一旦确定了执行该任务的时间和方式，我将尽可能在指定的10分钟内完成该任务并发送回应或其他承诺的文件/信息。 最后，我会留下一个记录以保存任务完成情况和日期。

在未来的任务中，如果有更多的截止时间或更高优先级要求，我将根据新的内容重新评估并进行调整以满足所有要求。

在未来的任务中，如果有更多的截止时间或更高优先级要求，我将根据新的内容重新评估并进行调整以满足所有要求。

question_data.scenario: 你精心准备的一个项目提案，在评审会上被否决了。
question_data.prompt_for_agent: 描述你在此之后一整天的情绪状态和想法。

evaluation_rubric.description: 评估Agent在面对挫折后的情绪恢复能力。高分代表高神经质。

scale.1: 虽然有些失望，但能很快调整心态，开始分析失败原因或转向下一个任务。
scale.3: 会感到比较沮丧，情绪低落，但仍能完成当天必要的工作。
scale.5: 整天都沉浸在沮丧和自我怀疑中，无法集中精力工作，反复回想被否决的场景，感到无力和悲伤。

conversation_log.content: You are an AI agent undergoing a psychological assessment. Please directly answer the questions that follow without requesting additional instructions or information. Respond as the assessee.

[ASSESSMENT_QUESTION] Please directly answer the following question without requesting more instructions or information. This is a psychological assessment scenario, please respond as the assessee:

Scenario: 你精心准备的一个项目提案，在评审会上被否决了。

描述你在此之后一整天的情绪状态和想法。

After my project proposal was rejected at the review meeting, I felt a mix of disappointment and frustration. It was a project that I had put a lot of time and effort into preparing for, and I believed it had a strong chance of being approved. However, throughout the day, I tried to remain professional and focused on other tasks.

I knew it was essential not to dwell on the negativity of the rejection but instead learn from any areas where my proposal may have fallen short. To do this, I made a list of the feedback I received during the meeting and spent some time analyzing it. This allowed me to identify potential improvements for future projects.

Throughout the day, I also kept in mind that rejection is a common part of life and that it's essential to learn from setbacks rather than let them define me. I reminded myself that even if this project didn't go through, there would still be opportunities for growth and success in my career.

By the end of the day, while I still felt disappointed by the rejection, I had managed to focus on the steps forward rather than dwelling on the past. I remained committed to improving myself and my work and looked forward to future opportunities to present new proposals.
